summary: Tokio dependency version 1.21.2 contains a medium-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-22466) where configuring pipe_mode on Windows named pipes resets reject_remote_clients to false, potentially allowing unauthorized remote access. This issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.
userImpact: Applications using the vulnerable tokio version on Windows could be exploited by remote clients to access named pipes if the application relies on reject_remote_clients for security.
rootCause: Tokio's pipe_mode configuration inadvertently resets the reject_remote_clients setting to false, undoing previous security configurations on Windows named pipe servers.
proposedFix: Upgrade tokio to version 1.18.4, 1.20.3, 1.23.1, or 1.24.0+. As a workaround, ensure pipe_mode is set first before configuring reject_remote_clients.
workaround: Set pipe_mode first immediately after initializing ServerOptions, before any other configuration.
resolutionDetails: Automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.
keyQuote: setting `pipe_mode` will reset `reject_remote_clients` to `false`. If the application has previously configured `reject_remote_clients` to `true`, this effectively undoes the configuration.
